Authors: Mohd Hashim S.H.; Ismail M.; Manaf H.; Hanapiah F.A.
Author full names: Mohd Hashim, Siti Hazyanti (57214545527); Ismail, Marina (22953294400); Manaf, Haidzir (55893942600); Hanapiah, Fazah Akhtar (55232895500)
Title: Development of dual cognitive task virtual reality game addressing stroke rehabilitation
Affiliations: Faculty of Computer and Mathematical Sciences, Universiti Teknologi MARA, Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Faculty of Health Science, Universiti Teknologi MARA Puncak Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Faculty of Medicine, Universiti Teknologi MARA, Sg. Buloh Selangor, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Mohd Hashim S.H., Faculty of Computer and Mathematical Sciences, Universiti Teknologi MARA, Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Ismail M., Faculty of Computer and Mathematical Sciences, Universiti Teknologi MARA, Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Manaf H., Faculty of Health Science, Universiti Teknologi MARA Puncak Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Hanapiah F.A., Faculty of Medicine, Universiti Teknologi MARA, Sg. Buloh Selangor, Malaysia
Abstract: Components of stroke rehabilitation requires the input of dual cognitive tasks, which involves the multitask of both motor and cognitive skills simultaneously. An individual who had suffered a stroke may have problems executing dual cognitive task. Rehabilitation can help to improve the function of dual cognitive tasking. Games have been used for rehabilitation intensely. Virtual reality games have been acknowledged to assist the stroke patient in the rehabilitation process. However, stroke rehabilitations require special virtual reality game design for the patient to perform the dual cognitive task. A study has been conducted to determine the criteria and components that are directed for dual cognitive task for patients with stroke. The information was gathered through literature review and expert opinion from both the game experts, rehabilitation physicians and therapists. This paper will discuss the development of the virtual reality game incorporating dual cognitive task for stroke rehabilitation based on the principles and elements that has been identified. The focus of the study is to develop a virtual reality game on dual cognitive task for stroke patients that combine all the game elements, game type, virtual reality environment and also game theory for dual cognitive task rehabilitation. The adoption of the correct rehabilitation elements and principles in the design and development of a virtual reality game addressing dual cognitive task will be able to assist the stroke patient in the rehabilitation process. © 2019 Association fo rComputing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Dual cognitive task; Serious game; Stroke rehabilitation; Virtual reality
Index Keywords: Augmented reality; Game theory; Neuromuscular rehabilitation; Serious games; Virtual reality; Cognitive skill; Cognitive task; Design and Development; Expert opinion; Literature reviews; Stroke patients; Stroke rehabilitation; Virtual-reality environment; Electronic medical equipment

Title: Anomaly detection based on profile signature in network using machine learning technique
Affiliations: Faculty of Computer and Mathematical Sciences, Malaysia Institute of Transport (MITRANS), Universiti Teknologi MARA (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, 40450, Malaysia; School of Postgraduate Studies, Asia Pacific University of Technology and Innovation (APU), Technology Park Malaysia, Bukit Jalil, 57000, Malaysia; Faculty of Computer and Mathematical Sciences, Universiti Teknologi MARA (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, 40450, Malaysia

Abstract: Within the last couple of years, a lot of IDSs have already been developed, both as research prototypes and as commercial systems. The aim of Intrusion Detection would be to positively identify all true attacks and adversely identify all non-attacks. Through the study of the procedure and signature of intrusion behaviors, IDS can produce a real-time reaction to intrusion occasions and invasion processes. The objective of this study is to work with appropriate algorithms for intrusion detection and hybrid them to find acceptable results and investigate on new hybrid techniques of intrusion detecting system with high accuracy. Moreover, it also aims to minimize a false positive and false negative alarms in networks. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Mohd Hashim S.H.; Mat Diah N.
Author full names: Mohd Hashim, Siti Hazyanti (57214545527); Mat Diah, Norizan (36138815700)
Title: Game engine framework for Non-Programming background
Source title: ICOS 2015 - 2015 IEEE Conference on Open Systems
Affiliations: Fakulti Sains Komputer and Matematik, Universiti Teknologi MARA (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor Darul Ehsan, 40450, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Mohd Hashim S.H., Fakulti Sains Komputer and Matematik, Universiti Teknologi MARA (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor Darul Ehsan, 40450, Malaysia; Mat Diah N., Fakulti Sains Komputer and Matematik, Universiti Teknologi MARA (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor Darul Ehsan, 40450, Malaysia
Abstract: Developing games is such a tedious task for Non-Programming background. They need assistance from a game engine to provide them with some elements so that they can easily develop the games despite not having any programming background. Currently game engine are full of programming and coding. So, although to help Non-programming background develop their game, the elements of game engine are improvise. The methodology involved are conducting preliminary research, identifying game engine elements, identifying research model, and obtaining research findings. This research will focus on game engine elements that help Non-programming background in developing games. The outcome will formulate a framework of game engine elements for Non-programming background. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: game; game element; game engine; Non-Programming background
Index Keywords: game; Game elements; Game Engine; Non-Programming background; Research models

Authors: Hashim S.H.B.M.; Ismail M.B.; Manaf H.B.A.; Hanapiah F.A.B.
Author full names: Hashim, Siti Hazyanti Binti Mohd (57214545527); Ismail, Marina Binti (22953294400); Manaf, Haidzir Bin Abd (55893942600); Hanapiah, Fazah Akhtar Binti (55232895500)
Title: Framework of virtual reality game on dual cognitive task for stroke rehabilitation
Source title: ISCAIE 2018 - 2018 IEEE Symposium on Computer Applications and Industrial Electronics
Affiliations: Faculty of Computer and Mathematical, Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Hashim S.H.B.M., Faculty of Computer and Mathematical, Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Ismail M.B., Faculty of Computer and Mathematical, Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Manaf H.B.A., Faculty of Computer and Mathematical, Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia; Hanapiah F.A.B., Faculty of Computer and Mathematical, Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM), Shah Alam, Selangor, Malaysia
Abstract: Dual cognitive task is a task that requires both motor and cognitive skills simultaneously. Due to the brain pathology, a stroke patient may have difficulties in performing dual cognitive task. In the field of serious games for rehabilitation one of the technique is the use of virtual reality. However, through our literature search, we found no virtual reality games designed specifically for dual cognitive task. Dual cognitive task rehabilitation requires a game design that is suitable for problems that are related to dual cognitive task and must also be suitable for stroke patient. Therefore, this paper will discuss the proposed framework design of a virtual reality game for dual cognitive task challenge for stroke rehabilitation. In order to design the framework, some known literature has been summarized. The focus of the study are performing dual cognitive task in stroke patients, virtual reality game and its challenges, game design element, game genre, virtual reality environment and also game theory for dual cognitive task rehabilitation. The expected result is the framework of virtual reality game on dual cognitive task for stroke rehabilitation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dual cognitive task; framework; serious game; stroke rehabilitation; virtual reality
Index Keywords: Electronic medical equipment; Game theory; Industrial electronics; Neuromuscular rehabilitation; Virtual reality; Brain pathologies; Cognitive skill; Cognitive task; framework; Framework designs; Literature search; Stroke rehabilitation; Virtual-reality environment; Serious games
